page.title: 13WHIT PROCESSIONS
page.content: The first Whit procession took place in Mossley in 1826. Since then the tradition has been maintained with all the parishes of every denomination taking part on Whit Friday each year. Those who take part meet in the morning, on the market square where hymns are sung before moving off.A United procession is formed with each church being led by its own banner and band (usually a Brass Band).After walking along Stockport Road the procession turns along Carr Hill Road before descending Mill Lane to Manchester Road. The various parishes split up in Bottom Mossley with St. Josephs,St.Johns and St.Georges continuing up Stamford Road to return to Top Mossley. In the afternoon the churches hold their own activities with music provided by a Brass Band.
